definition: the act of apprehending, especially apprehending a criminal, to hold back, as of a danger or an enemy
details:
noun
- the act of apprehending, especially apprehending a criminal
= example: the act of apprehending, especially apprehending a criminal
= synonyms: apprehension
- the state of inactivity following an interruption
= example: the state of inactivity following an interruption
= synonyms: check
verb
- to hold back, as of a danger or an enemy
= example: to hold back, as of a danger or an enemy
= synonyms: check, stop, turn back, contain, hold back
- to take into custody
= example: to take into custody
= synonyms: collar, nail, cop, pick up, apprehend, nab
- to cause to stop
= example: to cause to stop
= synonyms: halt, hold, stop
